items.synopsis: An explosion has killed hundreds of people at a Gaza hospital crammed with patients and displaced people, health authorities in the Hamas-ruled enclave say.

title.children: Israel and Palestinian militants blame each other after hospital blast kills hundreds in Gaza

items.synopsis: When Hamas launched its attack, thousands of Gazans who were working in Israel had their permits cancelled. Away from their families, these Palestinians found themselves suddenly trapped in a country that saw them as a threat, with no way to return home.

title.children: These Palestinians were working in Israel when Hamas launched its attack. Suddenly they had no way to return home

title.children: Coastal community cut off, schools closed as family grieves death of man killed by blaze in northern NSW

items.synopsis: The meeting has been cancelled as the US president travels to Israel. Follow live for the latest updates.

title.children: Jordan cancels summit with Biden and Egyptian and Palestinian leaders amid claims of strike on Gaza hospital

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Jordan has cancelled a summit it was to host in Amman on Wednesday with US President Joe Biden and the Egyptian and Palestinian leaders to discuss the situation in Gaza, the country's foreign minister, Ayman Safadi, said. Biden was expected to meet the Arab leaders following a solidarity visit to Israel. Reporting by Reuters
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Jordan cancels summit with Biden and Egyptian and Palestinian leaders

children.content: Jordan has cancelled a summit it was to host in Amman on Wednesday with US President Joe Biden and the Egyptian and Palestinian leaders to discuss the situation in Gaza, the country's foreign minister, Ayman Safadi, said.
Biden was expected to meet the Arab leaders following a solidarity visit to Israel.
Reporting by Reuters

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Family and friends have welcomed their loved ones home from the conflict-torn region on the first government-chartered flight into Sydney. In Brisbane, reporter Gemma Ferguson says roughly 100 passengers landed overnight, having transferred from Sydney: Gilad Bino, a Jewish man who grew up in Jerusalem, said he was "emotionally drained by the horrors that have happened in Israel". His family had travelled to Israel to celebrate an aunt's wedding. They were able to return home where he waited to welcome them home with a warm embrace. "The cycle of violence continues unfortunately," he said. "What happened there really shook my core — it was horrible, heartbreaking, to see the extent of violence and hatred." The Brisbane father said he was "really relived" to have his family home, having watched the horror unfold from afar.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Repatriation flights bring Australians back from Israel

children.content: Family and friends have welcomed their loved ones home from the conflict-torn region on the first government-chartered flight into Sydney.

children.content: In Brisbane, reporter Gemma Ferguson says
roughly 100 passengers landed overnight, having transferred from Sydney:
Gilad Bino, a Jewish man who grew up in Jerusalem, said he was "emotionally drained by the horrors that have happened in Israel".
His family had travelled to Israel to celebrate an aunt's wedding. They were able to return home where he waited to welcome them home with a warm embrace.
"The cycle of violence continues unfortunately," he said.
"What happened there really shook my core — it was horrible, heartbreaking, to see the extent of violence and hatred."
The Brisbane father said he was "really relived" to have his family home, having watched the horror unfold from afar.

props.alt: A man speaking inside an airport

children.content: Gilad Bino described the ongoing conflict as heartbreaking.
(ABC News: Stephen Cavenagh)

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh says the United States is responsible for the explosion at a Gaza hospital that killed hundreds of Palestinians. Haniyeh said in a televised speech late on Tuesday that Washington gave Israel "the cover for its aggression". "The hospital massacre confirms the enemy's brutality and the extent of his feeling of defeat," he said, adding that the blast would be "a new turning point". Haniyeh called on all Palestinian people "to get out and confront the occupation and the settlers". He also called on all Arabs, and Muslims to stage protests against Israel. Reporting by Reuters
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Hamas leader blames  US and Israel for blast at Gaza hospital

children.content: Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh says the United States is responsible for the explosion at a Gaza hospital that killed hundreds of Palestinians.
Haniyeh said in a televised speech late on Tuesday
that Washington gave Israel "the cover for its aggression".
"The hospital massacre confirms the enemy's brutality and the extent of his feeling of defeat," he said, adding that the blast would be "a new turning point".
Haniyeh called on all Palestinian people "to get out and confront the occupation and the settlers".
He also called on all Arabs, and Muslims to stage protests against Israel.
Reporting by Reuters

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Good morning — I'm making a guest appearance to bring you the latest from RBA governor Michele Bullock's "fireside chat" at AFSA's inaugural summit in Sydney. She was set to start chatting at 9:30am AEDT but has gotten started a little bit earlier than scheduled — but stay with us and I'll bring you the latest. If you want to tune in for yourself, you can watch the fireside chat below (spoiler though, there's no fire — just a fiddle leaf fig plant.)
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: RBA governor Michele Bullock discussing inflation, oil prices in Sydney

featuredLink.title: Speech by Michele Bullock, Governor, at the AFSA Annual Summit Panel

children.content: Good morning — I'm making a guest appearance to bring you the latest from RBA governor Michele Bullock's "fireside chat" at AFSA's inaugural summit in Sydney.
She was set to start chatting at 9:30am AEDT but has gotten started a little bit earlier than scheduled — but stay with us and I'll bring you the latest.
If you want to tune in for yourself, you can watch the fireside chat below (spoiler though, there's no fire — just a fiddle leaf fig plant.)

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Whitehaven Coal has won the bidding for BHP's Queensland coal mines. The news was included in BHP's quarterly update and financial details of the proposed deal have not been disclosed. The Daunia and Blackwater coal mines are owned by BHP in partnership with Japan's Mitsubishi Development Corporation. It comes after BHP sold out of its South Walker Creek and Poitrel coal mines (also in Queensland) last year. The proposed acquisitions come as Whitehaven faces questions from minority shareholder Bell Rock around its paused share buyback program.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Whitehaven to buy BHP's coal mines

children.content: Whitehaven Coal has won the bidding for BHP's Queensland coal mines.
The news was included in BHP's quarterly update and financial details of the proposed deal have not been disclosed.
The Daunia and Blackwater coal mines are owned by BHP in partnership with Japan's Mitsubishi Development Corporation.
It comes after BHP sold out of its South Walker Creek and Poitrel coal mines (also in Queensland) last year.
The proposed acquisitions come as Whitehaven faces questions from minority shareholder Bell Rock around its paused share buyback program.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Glencore has announced it will close all copper mining operations at its Mount Isa mine, affecting at least 1,200 employees. The mine is one of the biggest underground mines in the world. You can continue reading this story here:
